California blog travel

4 May 2012

I took a little vacation last week to visit my family in California. I hadn't been back since I moved to Chicago last year, and it was wonderful to see everyone. I also got to spend some time up at Sea Ranch, and was able to see baby harbor seals in the rookery. It was just about the most relaxing vacation I could ever have. But now I'm back to work, and things are back to normal. There's no such thing as too many beautiful vacation photos.

Colin's parents have a massive cat bigger than my torso.

Sophia's, our favorite restaurant and bar to visit in Davis.

On the way up to Yuba City to see my mom.

Fake sheep on the hills in Sonoma.

Everything is incredibly green right now! California been getting so much rain.

Real sheep!

Random statue in a field in Napa.

Wine! Wine!!

And then there was Sea Ranch! One of my favorite places to visit when I go to California.

Relaxing with my ocean view.

There are some baby harbor seals with their mamas on the rocks.

Morning view.

Colin's idea of a suitable wine pour while vacationing.

Sunset.

Sea anemones!

Hanging out in the tide pools.

Little waterfall and small creek running into the sea.

Waves, and the bluest ocean I've seen in awhile.

Sea Ranch.



About pattern purchases

Patterns are sold as downloadable PDF files through Ravelry, with payments processed by PayPal. You do not need an account to use either service.

If you have a Ravelry account, I suggest logging in prior to purchasing so that patterns are added to your library.

Get pattern help

Pattern support is provided free of charge for all of my patterns. We respond as quickly as possible, but sometimes it can take a day or two.

Submit a new help request through Zendesk.

You can also use Zendesk to report errors and ask non-technical questions.

Alternatively, you can try the Ravelry group.

Support is only provided via Zendesk.

FAQ

Can I teach a class using your knitting pattern?

Teaching licensing is temporarily on hold and should resume in 2014.

Can I sell items made using your knitting patterns for profit or charity?

Not at this time.

How do I order wholesale copies for my LYS?

Pattern wholesaling is temporarily on hold and should resume in 2014.

I found an error, how do I report it?

Oh newts! Submit your error through Zendesk and we will fix it.

Happy knitting!
